title: Oxfordshire Live: Wednesday 12 October - BBC News
summary: arrest made after fire in oxford .
demolition firm to leave didcot power station .
david cameron reveals his new job .

documents.title: that 's all for today
text: thanks for reading .
we 'll have more news , sport , weather and travel from around oxfordshire tomorrow from 08:00 .

documents.title: oxfordshire hotel chain travelodge creates 1,000 new jobs
text: oxfordshire hotel group travelodge is creating 1,000 jobs in the coming months , ranging from managers and receptionists to plumbers and electricians .
author: Witney Gazette

documents.title: pictures of banbury multi-storey car park demolition
text: here are the latest demolition of bolton road multi-storey car park in # banbury

documents.title: woman 'seriously injured ' in house fire
text: a woman has suffered `` serious injuries '' in a house fire in oxford , thames valley police has said .
a man has also been arrested on sus of attempted murder after the blaze at a property on balfour road , in the blackbird leys area , at about 10:10 .
the woman was taken to hospital by ambulance crews .

documents.title: didcot to oxford rail services disrupted
text: services between didcot parkway and oxford may be altered or delayed by 30mins as network rail work to repair a section of defective track .
services running via didcot parkway and oxford may be altered or delayed by 40mins due to speed restrictions during emergency track repairs .
disruption caused by earlier track repairs between oxford and didcot parkway has now ended .
apologies for any delay caused to your journey .
as someone suggest better to close the entire network for 2 years and get it fixed instead of charging for a third rate service

documents.title: travel update : delays on a40 northern by-pass westbound
text: there are long delays on the a40 northern by-pass road westbound between the b4150 marsh lane junction in oxford and eynsham roundabout .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: contract axed after power station deaths
text: contract axed after power station deaths

documents.title: fancy a chat and run ?
text: in the week of world mental health day , england athletics and the charity mind are encouraging people to # runandtalk to improve their mental wellbeing .
people are being urged to run one mile or further and to chat with friends , family , colleagues or other runners .
find out more about the event and how you can get involved here .
you can find out more about getting into running with our special guide .

documents.title: road closure while police investigate incident
text: balfour road in cowley is closed between blackbird leys road and cuddeson way because police are dealing with an incident .
we 'll provide more details when they are available .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: oxford bus stop suspended from tomorrow
text: service update : 13th-20th october , the oxford bound stop on lime road will be suspended ( city4a & city35a ) :

documents.title: didcot park rape not connected to schoolgirl abduction , police say
text: police have said a suspected rape in a didcot park is not believed to be connected to the rape and abduction of a 14-year-old girl in oxford .
the woman , in her 30s , was found at about 19:00 bst on tuesday in a distressed state by a member of the public in newlands avenue , didcot .

documents.title: man held for attempted murder after fire
text: man held for attempted murder after fire

documents.title: chemical leak in stream kills 1,700 fish
text: chemical leak in stream kills 1,700 fish

documents.title: artisan distillery plan for vacant headington barns approved by city council
text: an artisan distillery in oxford could be producing gin , vodka and whisky in the new year after plans were approved .
author: Oxford Mail

documents.title: 50 new jobs at travelodge 's thame hq
text: about 50 new jobs are to be created at travelodge 's head office in thame , the company have announced .
the hotel group is creating 1,000 jobs across the country in the coming months , ranging from managers and receptionists to plumbers and electricians , as well staff at its head office .

documents.title: man arrested for attempted murder after woman injured in fire
text: a man has been arrested on sus of attempted murder after a fire at a house in oxford , as reported by the bbc earlier .
police were called to reports of a blaze at a property on balfour road , in the blackbird leys area , at 10:09 .
a woman was found injured at the scene and taken to hospital by ambulance crews .
the road has been closed and officers are conducting house-to-house inquiries in the area .

documents.title: hospitals appointments cancelled over maintenance problems
text: hundreds of patients in oxfordshire had their treatment delayed or cancelled last year due to issues with hospitals and their maintenance .
there were 510 incidents recorded by oxford university hospitals nhs foundation trust last year , with 4,900 incidents in england 's hospitals last year .
incidents in hospitals such as power cuts or problems with pest control led to patient services being delayed or cancelled .
author: Press Association

documents.title: breakingman arrested on sus of attempted murder after oxford fire
text: a man has been arrested on sus of attempted murder after a fire at a property in blackbird leys , oxford , this morning .
a woman was injured in a fire at a property on balfour road and has been taken to hospital .

documents.title: lights green for driverless car trials
text: driverless cars on our streets are a step closer to becoming a reality .
vehicles developed an oxford company carried passengers on streets in milton keynes yesterday on a landmark day for the technology .

documents.title: 'high ammonia levels ' found in river near witney
text: thames water says `` high ammonia levels '' from its witney sewage treatment works have been found in a stream near witney lake .
reports yesterday on social media warned dog walkers not to go along the stream between ducklington and stanton harcourt .

thames water engineers were at the scene yesterday testing the water and the firm have said the pollution is `` most likely substances being put into the drainage network which should n't be there '' .
we 've identified high ammonia levels in the stream which we believe are due to discharges from our sewage treatment works .

we 're investigating what has caused these discharges to contain such high ammonia levels , most likely substances being put into the drainage network which should n't be there , and are supporting the environment agency in their work to protect the stream from further damage .

documents.title: breaking1,700 fish die in chemical leak near witney river
text: about 1,700 fish have died after `` high ammonia levels '' were discovered in a stream near witney yesterday , the environment agency have said .
it 's investigating the cause of the deaths on a 2km stretch of colwell brook and queen emma 's dyke near witney lake .

documents.title: demolition firm leaves work at didcot power station
text: the firm used to demolish the didcot a power station has been told its services are no longer required by the site owners .
coleman and company was working on the site when the boiler house partially collapsed , killing four workmen .
in may , it was removed from the recovery operation to find the missing workers but was due to resume work to clear the site .
but in a statement , the company said `` we will not be continuing with the remaining demolition and site clearance work at didcot a power station .
we agreed with site owners rwe , that this is in the best interests of all parties . ''

documents.title: meet lewis and nico
text: lewis hamilton and nico rosberg have dropped into the mercedes ' factory in brackley after their constructors ' championship win .

documents.title: in honour of bake-off
text: radio oxford 's phil mercer has been learning how to cook , tudor-style , today at sulgrave manor .

documents.title: cameron reveals his next job
text: david cameron has revealed his first new role after quitting political life will be to lead an expansion of the national citizen service for teenagers .
the former prime minister and soon-to-be-replaced mp for witney said the scheme , which he set up during his time in office , was `` the big society in action '' .
the ncs aims to prepare teenagers for work through team-building activities and community projects .
mr cameron will be chairman of ncs patrons , aiming to make the course `` a normal part of growing up '' .

documents.title: missing woman lauren seaman found safe and well
text: a woman who was reported missing last week from henley-on-thames has been found , police have said this morning .
lauren seaman , aged 20 , lives in faringdon had been last seen in york road , henley-on-thames , at about 11:15 last thursday .
police have thanked all those who shared messages to find her .

documents.title: weather : cloudy with scattered showers
text: it will be rather cloudy today with scattered showers .
these will be heaviest and most frequent in the northern parts such as banbury .
a few sunny spells are likely at times too though , especially further south .
highs of 15c ( 59f ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: £ 1m ambulance charity target
text: an ambitious plan to make sure that no one in oxfordshire is more than eight minutes from a community defibrillator is being launched today .
a target of £ 1million has been set by the south central ambulance service charity and it 's also looking to fund more support for community responders .

documents.title: woman raped in didcot park
text: a woman has been raped in a park in didcot , police have said .
the woman , in her 30s , was found at about 19:00 yesterday in a distressed state by a member of the public in newlands avenue .
a section of edmonds park remains cordoned off by police while detectives carry out further investigations .
thames valley police said the victim was being supported by specially-trained officers and extra patrols had been put in place in near the park .

documents.title: travel latest : so far so good in oxford , but a34 'bump ' could cause issues
text: get up-to-the minute details on these incidents , and the rest of the county 's travel news on the bbc travel site or follow @ bbcoxtravel .
city centre : generally coping and moving well on all inbound routes this morning. # botley road , # woodstock road and # banbury road .
expect some delays on # a34 southbound just before # peartree
author: Al Ryan
BBC Oxford travel presenter

documents.title: welcome to oxfordshire live
text: a very good morning .
it 's going to be mainly cloudy today .
we 'll be here with the latest news and views from around our fair county .
do n't forget : let us know what 's happening in your area via email , facebook or twitter .
